page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Sheep have for a long time been the dominant activity but now cereals are taking the lead, particularly winter wheat and winter barley. Farms are very isolated but the baker and the milkman call. They employ few labourers, one farmer employs only an independent contractor who lives locally. The farmer at Dynes Barn Farm has owned the farm for thirty years. He has 100 acres with poultry, wheat, some peas and a few calves and horses. He employs one farm labourer. Winter wheat has been grown for some years and maize is grown for silage. The cattle are beef, mostly Hereford cross. The farmer is experimenting with asparagus as a cash crop. 1985 has not had very adverse effect except that the crop took longer to dry out.
